verb.description: Return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength.
examples: Neil is still recovering from shock
the economy has begun to recover

verb.description: Find or regain possession of (something stolen or lost)
Remove or extract (an energy source or industrial chemical) for use, reuse, or waste treatment.

noun.description: A defined position of a firearm forming part of a military drill.
examples: bring the firelock to the recover

origin: Middle English (originally with reference to health): from Anglo-Norman French recoverer, from Latin recuperare get again.
